raw_json.html_title: If you don’t use R to fit multilevel models, there’s no point in reading this one | R-bloggers
raw_json.main_html:
If you don’t use R to fit multilevel models, there’s no point in reading this one

Posted on October 6, 2007 by Andrew Gelman in R bloggers | 0 Comments

[This article was first published on Search Results for R, and kindly contributed to R-bloggers]. (You can report issue about the content on this page here)
Want to share your content on R-bloggers? click here if you have a blog, or here if you don't.

David Afshartous writes, What is the difference between sim() and mcsamp(), if any? If there is a difference, what should I expect in terms of difference in results? My reply:…
